text.section: Unless sufficient facilities are not available, the managing official of a correctional facility shall receive and confine an individual arrested by a police employee without warrant or on warrant from a county.

section.section:
An individual confined under subsection (a) of this section:
is deemed to be in the custody of the Department; and
shall remain confined until a court of competent jurisdiction issues a warrant or other process, or the individual is returned to the county.
Before the issuance of a warrant or process, an individual confined under subsection (a) of this section may be released only to and on written order of a police employee.
This section does not abridge the right of an individual to be taken before a judicial officer of the State promptly after arrest.

The managing official of a correctional facility in which an individual is confined under this section, shall notify the State's Attorney immediately if the individual is confined for more than 12 hours.
